casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff—Appellee, v. Phuc LUC, Defendant—Appellant. No. 08-7103. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Aug. 21, 2008. Decided: Aug. 27, 2008. Phuc Luc, Appellant Pro Se. Kelli Hamby Ferry, Assistant United States Attorney, Alexandria, Virginia, for Appellee.

Before WILLIAMS, Chief Judge, and KING and DUNCAN, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Phuc Luc appeals the district court’s order denying his motion to reduce his sentence pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 3582(c)(2) (2000). We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. United States v. Luc, No. 1:05-cr-00275-LMB-l (E.D. Va. June 6, 2008). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
